LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey there %r%; you know, I was just admiring what a %random(great day it is to be with someone stunningly attractive, fine day it is to be with such amazingly stunning people)%. Don’t you agree?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I, um, yes I suppose it is that type of day indeed…%gender(r, heh heh, tee hee)%...%sweetie%...

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You know %r%, it’s hard not to notice how your…features…are a lot like the plains of England—um, uh…hang on…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Plains of England? %random(All bumpy and grassy and wet, Dirty and flaccid and uninteresting)%? Ooh what a charmer. %gender(r, heh heh, tee hee)%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Uh, no…not like that…mm…hm…I swear I had something for this…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Um. Better luck next time %sweetie%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah %r%, what a fine day it is to be next to your %gender(r, masculine jawline of the heavens, goddess-like curvature to make a person go wild)%!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Um…isn’t this supposed to be an indirect flirt?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Huh…?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Um. Nothing. Listen I’m not certain you know what you’re -

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah, your lovely eyes! Your soft lips!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Right then. Sure. I have those.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey %r%, come take a look at this rose over here.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Alright, sure…it’s just a rose. Many bloom in the gardens around here.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well, to any person out of millions I suppose it is just a rose, but to a large handful of individuals this rose is perfect. Look closely at the solid stem, the soft but strong passionately colored petals. It all swirls together into an absolutely %random(r, handsome, beautiful)% specimen. Wouldn’t you agree?
Something wrong %sweetie%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: No, no - just your eyes - they’re stunning. Ahem. And yes - I agree quite thoroughly actually. About the rose, I mean.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Of course.
Such a lovely day isn’t it? The weather is perfect, the manor is stunning—ah, and speaking of stunning, I’m also in the company of…well let’s just say you aren’t a lesser match for the manor.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I’m not certain I appreciate such talk from someone I hardly know in such a way. Maybe you should rethink your dialogue.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: But such a shame it would be for the manor’s competition not to know just how incredible they were—respectfully, of course. I’m not saying anything except that the person next to me is more awesome than the manor. Is that so bad?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I…suppose not. Thank you, %i%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Have I ever mentioned that I’m not much of a shy %gender(i, fellow, woman)%? I usually prefer boldness, and not just in myself but in other people. I admire all types of boldness, and even shy people can be bold, and in this case…you, my %dear%, have this…exquisite boldness about you.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Huh. Well I’m certainly glad that my flavor of boldness suits you %r%. It would be a right shame if it didn’t I think.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I couldn’t agree more.
Wow %r%, you have %random(the most amazing shoes I’ve ever seen...they really accent your calves, incredibly good taste in shirts...yours brings out your figure rather dashingly)%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %gender(r, Well thank you...truly...your words are as sweet as sugar, Oh...tee-hee...you are such a pleasant tease)%!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: It is my utmost pleasure %r%.
No one appreciates a brown noser %i%, come now. Your accusations are correct, but let’s try being discrete, hm?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: No one appreciates a brown noser %i%, come now. Your accusations are correct, but let’s try being discrete, hm?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You understand, %r%, I’ve heard a kiss on the hand is quite continental…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %gender(r, And lucky me not being a girl...diamonds are no best friends of mine, But diamonds aren’t always a girl’s best friend...tee-hee)%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well how about a kiss on the lips then, %sweetie%? Is that perhaps a better way to your heart?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Why, that sounds like the most straight forward path there…

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Would it be oh so awful my love if right here and right now I was to pin you to the wall and....

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Stop! You can just stop right there %i%. I’ll have no part in these shenanigans of yours, you %pejorative%!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, %r%, I’ve looked upon you for…for so many hours and I’ve come to understand that I must be with you, that my lips must rest upon yours!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Ah, %i%, is that an offer?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Is that a yes?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I do believe it is, %sweetie%. I do believe it is.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I certainly hope that I haven’t made my attempts at your heart subtle, %sweetie%. And as they say, the soul’s words flow through the mouth...and I’d like our souls to touch. Or…soul’s words…
I’d like to kiss you.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Uh…
Sure %i%, that sounds %gender(r, nice, lovely)%. Let me just find a mint.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hi there, %sweetie%. I was hoping to get your attention. You see, I’ve been watching your %gender(r, strong jaw and broad shoulders, soft eyes and beautiful hair)% for a while now, and I’ve decided I’d like to…put those strong lips to trial.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh…? Oh! I…I see…I’m not so sure…that I’m all that ready to put…to put anyone’s lips to trial I’m afraid. So sorry, um, good day, for the moment.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh…Okay. I’m sorry…
So, %sweetie%. I know you’ve been eyeing my %gender(i, muscles, breasts)% for a good long while now.
And since you’re so, hm hm hm, understandably entranced, I figured I’d let you caress them. But this is a one time offer %sweetie%, so get your fill.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %gender(r, Are you serious? I’m very glad to say that there will be no caressing of anything today! I’m so so sorry. Humph!, Ugh—you are, just so…ugh! This is an offer I think I’ll just have to pass up.)%

Rule.name: intent-network down: buddy (responder toward initiator)
Rule.description: intent is to lower the buddy network of the responder toward initiator

Rule.name: A good buddy wouldn't start such an argument...

InfluenceRule.name: initiator can't have a high buddy network with the responder
This doesn't matter as much, but it can't happen unless the responder has a low(ish) budnet too

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hm, you know I've been thinking about the horses here in the country. They're all just such an off color.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Truly? I find that the horses in the city look worse off than those in the countryside.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Perhaps it is just your poor taste, %r%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Or it might just be yours.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: The %random(weather/mood right now)% is a tad bit bleak don’t you think?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Not as bleak as your conversation, I’m afraid. %random(Bother someone else with your babble why don’t you?/Go mingle or something…or not, just go elsewhere.)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You know, %r%, I’ll be blunt. Your shoes are just utterly posh.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Are you serious? Friend, I don’t have time to get into this right now. Why don’t you bug off?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I've been finding as of late that I don't much like the cutlery here at the manor.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Truly? I don't find there's anything wrong with it.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Clearly you haven't seem some of the finer cutlery there is in this fine country. Shame you don't have better taste.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hmph! Who develops anything but a mild sensory passing at cutlery anyhow?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: It always surprises me: country winters. They're so cold! Makes me wonder if why anybody living out here can stand to abide by that new weight loss trend. It might be better to get fat to stay further warm!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Indeed, good %gender(lass/lad)%! You’re right; these country winters are infamously chilly, but getting thicker than a cow’s gut might help! Good day!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You know…I’ve just realized I actually quite admire the trim, but the color on the walls is quite dreary.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Haha! hic I agree young city walker. hic In the moonlight the sun defiles us all with…hic ponies! Mahaha! It should be blue!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hm, you know, I've been doing a bit of pondering, and I do think that I prefer living in the country to the city.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Are you certain of that? The country can be an awfully dull place. The city is a bustling hive, much more comfortable.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: My comment was hardly an excuse to attempt poetry, %r%. You’re better off sticking to reading it.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You bloated aggressor! Emancipate yourself from my presence at once!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yes, flower of the night sky…my majesty.
I do believe I've just discovered that I'm not a firm supporter of this old rug here...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mm, that’s nice…why don’t you go…swimming or something equally less involving me.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Goodness there is such a foul smell in the air. Can't you notice it?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh gracious good %gender(i, lad/lass)%, your tongue is outstandingly irritating.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Did my comment offend you oh so very much?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Quite enough indeed. Perhaps for the moment you should go elsewhere.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hm, the hedges could use a bit of a trim. Rather ugly now, don’t you agree?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Dearest, how can you even make that quip? Let’s not argue about such petty things.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hm. You know, looking around I've found this place to be unbearingly dusty.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well it isn't so bad. Perhaps you're just sensitive to it.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Sensitive?! Pah! I'm not sensitive.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Ah, and we resume the misery do we? Very well.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Goodness if the air here were any dryer I’d shrivel into an unsightly husk. Miserable place.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I’m afraid the air isn’t dry at all—and your insults to my home are utmost surprising. Let’s refrain from pursuing the topic further.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Goodness the grass is certainly dead looking today.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Certainly? I find it in acceptable form.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ugh, it's piiful. I often wonder how anyone can stand it.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Must you be so aggravating?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: How am I being aggravating?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Right. I'm to go visit the loo then.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You know what %r%, your pompous and spoiled ways have been especially grating as of late. You should really consider not being such a-

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %random(I say!, Excuse me?!)% How have I in any way been as you say, pompous and spoiled-you-you inconsiderate, miserable-

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %random(Good grief!, Lordy Lou!)% %gender(r, Sir, Woman)%, how can you not see it! Look at yourself right now! Pretension knows no greater proprietor!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You are filth itself %i%!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Goodness me %r%, I cannot even stand to look at you. How miserable must you be to act the way you do.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mmm, having a %random(rough day?, bout of misery?, child’s moment?)% That’s all well and good %sweetie%, but why don’t you %random(go over there somewhere?, go find a nice miserable corner to sit in?, go eat a rotted pig?)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I - I might just do that…
%shocked% %r% I just don’t think I can be around you right now. I can’t stand the way you %random(speak such nonsense, walk around in that girthy strut)%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: …That’s alright %i%, I’ll try to stay out of your way.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I - wait - don’t leave…oh…I didn’t mean to…I’m such a %pejorative%.
%shocked% You must understand, %r%, that your supposed political views are just absolutely posh! I can’t believe you would support such an innocuous party!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hm, I'm not so certain your deduction stands to merit. I believe that my political preference is the right one. They support the civil rights.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Civil rights? How can those even be thought about in times of war like these? We should be focusing on the military and increasing political sanction!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: And it's thoughts like those that are going to crumble our society from the inside! We need to invest more time here, in our own country!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Gah! But if we let others rise to power we won't have a country to build upon!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: It seems we are at an impass, if only due to your refusal to understand my point...

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ha! %r$ it’s so positively amusing how completely inferior to me you really are. It’s no wonder %random(you haven’t any friends, you are so disrespected)%!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What’s this? You know nothing about me you %pejorative% You’re sickeningly trite for a %gender(i, gentleman, lady)% with such a stature.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Don’t mock me! Your admittance of my position only reminds me further of your insignificance!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You are a foul human being %i%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: And you’re as terrible as the devil himself. Jog on with this riff raff.

%random(Gracious me, Well now)% %r%, you are ever so dull looking today. Ever think of %gender(r, shaving that grotesque stubble, applying just a touch of lipstick that isn’t the color of a cow’s ass)%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: …No %i%, I really haven’t considered such an option. Have you ever thought of %random(not being such a fulsome pig devouring piss dweller, not being an obtuse girthy eyesore to rival an aging mare)%?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You really are bitter when it comes to your lack of any admirable features aren’t you %r%? It’s a pity—a little bit of confidence goes a long way %sweetie%. Go slide in a mud river—it will really bring out those gruesome features.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I feel like I won’t be the only one to slide down a river soon…

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: What was that?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Nothing, %i%, nothing at all.

Rule.name: intent-remove status: responder is enemies with initiator

Predicate.name: intent-remove status: responder is enemies with initiator

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hail %r%. Listen, about our trifles as of late...let’s not let them get in the way of starting this relationship over.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hm...I suppose I'll consider it.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: So, not right now then?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Lest you can agree to behave yourself starting now.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: That is an agreement I can make, if for the sake of stopping this hatred before it goes too far south.

So %r%...I’ve been pondering our tumbling relationship lately…and was wondering if perhaps you were willing to make a truce? We’ve both done bad things…well, said bad things, and I…ahem…is that a…a no face you’re giving me?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Listen %i%, our relationship is on stilts for a reason, it’s an awful thing to say the things you’ve said and then expect a truce to come out of it without even having the dignity to apologize.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah. So that is a no then.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mm, yes, that is a no. Reflect on what you just said and talk to me later.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, if I might have a moment? …Uh, listen I wanted to apologize for all the unfortunate words that have been spoken between us. It truly is a menace…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %random(You’re apologizing, You’re serious)%? Well, %i%, I apologize too. Our conversations have been…unpleasant.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: To new friendship then!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well…let’s not jump the wagon just yet %gender(i, sir, lass)%. But yes, let’s be a bit more amicable toward each other.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah, %r%, listen my friend you can hide your guilt and just apologize now. I know you feel terrible for all the ridiculous things you’ve claimed in my presence, and I agree, they were terrible, but let’s put that all aside and just focus on being charmed friends, eh?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Truly? This is your notion as to how to improve our friendship? By slinging insults further still?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Insults? I'm merely pointing out what you have done to perpetuate this situation.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hmph. I'm disinclined to accept your generous suggestion of me apologizing. You should take some long amount of time to reflect on the things you've said %i%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Mm, having a pleasant time %r%? You look so enchanted standing there.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Umm…yes? What are you playing at %i%? Am I standing on a trap door over a poison pit?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: No, %sweetie% but that is a grand thought, that. I was just simply going to say that now is the time to apologize if you want to be my friend again.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I…don’t think regaining your fickle friendship is on the agenda for the next hour…

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: So…%r%, listen. I’ve felt awful about the things we’ve...I’ve said in our conversations. I was hoping that you would be willing to settle a truce with me. I don’t want our short time together to be muddled by these poisonous words…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Really %i%? You expect a truce after everything you’ve said to me?!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well you’ve said some nasty bits yourself there, %sweetie% -

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %random(Your words have been more than poison, You have been a just...profoundly awful human being)%, %random(and I think you should take your words and stuff them somewhere far into the darkness of your bitter black heart, and I think that you should just forget about a chance of a truce between us if you’re going to remain such an insensitive beast)%. Good day.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh %sweetie%, it has been an honor getting to know you in these few short hours.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: It has been quite a joy on my end too.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I'd like to continue seeing more of you, if you'd permit it.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That sounds wondrous, I was just about to suggest the very same thing.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, %random(your eyes are quite lovely I guess,your face is…better than a horse’s,you look like you have big…talent)%. Want to go mingle elsewhere? Somewhere private maybe?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Ugh, you %pron(filthy scoundrel!,miserable wench!)% That’s your idea of courtship?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You don’t %random(admire my word craft?,find me illustrious?,want me?)%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Not today, %gender(r, city boy,city girl)%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, goodness, %r%, funny we run into each other so much isn’t it?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I think I’ve seen you once, maybe twice…Is something wrong?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Wrong? Gracious no, I’ve just bitten my tongue. See? Mua, mua, la.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: How very odd. Good day to you then.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: My %sweetie%, I’d love to run off with you into the plains to be forever lost in our love.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mmm, my %sweetie%, that is a hard to put down offer. But I’m afraid we should stay here at the manor. T’would be rude to abandon such a lovely party.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You are the loveliest of things here %r%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You’re very kind. %random(I’ll accept more gushing another time.,I’m always open to your compliments.)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, I’m glad we are close, but %random(do you think we could be something more?,do you want to spend time together in…other ways?,have you ever thought of maybe being naughty? With me?)%

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, %sweetie%, %random(I’ve certainly thought about it…,I wouldn’t mind…experimenting…,that sounds quite tantalizing…)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hm, can’t say I haven’t thought about myself.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Maybe we can act on those thoughts then. Later. Maybe. See you around, %sweetie%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Goodness, %r%, you are certainly %random(ravishing,tantalizing)% to look at. How ever did you tone those %gender(r, pulsing muscles,marvelous curves)%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %gender(r, Oh my…,Teehee!)% What a pleasant compliment. You %random(are quite marvelous to look at as well.,are quite a catch yourself.)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: That’s good to hear, %sweetie%. Let’s talk some more.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Let’s. *wink*

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Have you heard about the %random(man in the city who was caught running naked through the big government building, woman from the north who caused an accidental fire in a county pub, director of Renaissance...that famous play...who killed himself last week)%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Of course! It was one of the more %random(lucrative, interesting)% articles I’ve read in the Daily lately.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You wouldn’t catch me doing something like that, that is for sure!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Indeed—I wouldn’t expect to!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Did you see the city crime rating in the Daily? I couldn’t believe how high it was!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I can’t believe that you find that babble interesting. Who could possibly be concerned about such uselessly trivial matters such as those?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Trivial? Wow. Well that is an interesting opinion.
So I reckon that the chancellor of the Big City Arts Academy is pulling his student’s legs with the increase in tuition,high as it is. He’s a funny sort of man so I’ve heard.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You don’t believe that the cost of education should be higher if there are more services provided?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Do you?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That isn’t the point. I’m trying to spark a, how you say, intellectual conversation.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh…well I suppose I could see either side of it of course. They have been offering more services at the Academy, but it is a shame the students currently enrolled didn’t find out about the increase until their payment was due. Guess we just live in the type of world where almost everything is subjective.

I’ve heard rumor that the woman in the manor down the road a ways has %random(a deadly illness...and contagious to boot, murdering look about her, a dark secret)%. I’d say the proof is already there. You agree yes?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mm, well no not quite. I think the woman you’re talking about is %random(the usual sort, not an off woman at all)%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Are you kidding? Can’t you see how obvious a truth that is?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: My but you are trite! Take your gabby gossip elsewhere!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Did you catch word of the zookeeper in London who was asked to care for a baby African lion by the Queen herself?
Oh you really should read the article! It’s grand. I bet if I could just find the Daily that I swear I saw laying around here I could find it, assuming it’s a week old edition of course! Let me see…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Frankly %i% you’re really beginning to bore me. It’s best you scurry along to do something else.

Effect.PerformanceRealization: dishonest initiator reject adds status guilty and pities

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %positiveadj%! So once upon a time in my not so far gone youth…don’t snicker, it’s impolite, I %random(met a famous author, met a famous politician, met a well renowned arms man from the city militia, met a well thought after poet from the capital)%!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Really? Well that’s good and grand, do you remember their name?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Unfortunately I can’t recall. It’s sad I know but I was small and %random(in a side alley with my mum, at the grocer with my uncle, in the market with a family friend)%. There was really so much going on at that place. I merely remembered that the kind %random(woman, man)% gave me a lollipop.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wow, that’s ever so…fascinating! Thank you for sharing %i%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %greeting% %r%. Care to hear an intriguing story about my life as a %gender(i, lad, lass) in London? It’s quite good, one of my absolute favorites in fact!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mm, I’m so very sorry %i% but I’m just not in the mood. Such a shame I know. Good day.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh…Okay. Such a shame it is indeed.
You know, not two years ago I won an award at the city Faire de Mare for best grooming techniques. It was a wild show!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wow, %i%, that’s a very prestigious award! You must have been very proud to receive such an honor!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: R-really? Most people mock, I mean, well, they really shouldn’t after all it is, in fact, as you say, a prestigious award…Ahem. Thank you %r% for you ear in this.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Of course %i%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You know %r%, I was nominated regional fun runner of the year not two weeks ago. It was a gracious nomination of course but I declined, so many other things to do, you understand.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You…have too much to do to accept an award? That seems just a tad off…

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well actually, it’s a rather large conference one must attend if nominated you see. In a far off northern city to boot. I don’t even remember the name.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wow. That sounds rather fanciful. It’s a shame you didn’t go.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well if I had gone I wouldn’t be here right now. And wouldn’t that be such an awful shame?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: It truly would. I am glad you decided against it then, heh heh.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah, pardon for a moment, I just need to stretch these glutes. Hah hah…oh, stubborn solid things these are. Mm hm hmmm…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Alright then…seems a bit odd. What are you trying at, doing this here?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well I have a race in a week, in good old London. Ah, ah, ahhh that feels rather nice. It’s a big race too, can’t remember the name, but it isn’t my job to do such trivial things. Just have to run it and win it eh %r%? Hah hah hah!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, you mean the fantastic Race de La France one week from today? Well that’s fantastic! How ever did you manage to get a runner’s invitation?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, you understand, just me being me I guess. Haha! Race de La France, yes that was the one. I can’t wait !

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Quite. Good %gender(i, Sir, lass)%, I made the name up. Race de La France doesn’t exist.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Wha - ?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Why don’t you go stretch your sagging glutes elsewhere dear %gender(i, boy, girl)%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah, aren’t these shoes just marvelous? I had them custom made in the city!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh…strange I swear they sell those exact type of shoes at a shop here in the countryside.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Are you kidding? Come now %r%, have you really seen shoes of this cosmic magnitude anywhere in the verse of your subtly beating country side loving heart at the whim of a mere shoemaker whom he himself cannot conceive of the possibilities of the there and here and everywhere after!? In short %sweetie%, can’t you see these are the best custom made shoes in the country?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I…I guess so? Sure. Yes. Is that what you want me to say? … Yes.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %sweetie%, I have procured a gift for you, to suit your %gender(r, devilishly handsome self./illustrious beauty.)%

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Why, this is a very generous offer, %i%, %random(thank you kindly!, You’re too kind!)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: My %gender(r, most gentlemanly of men,/sophisticated of women,)% I’ve brought you a small token of my affection for you.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hmph! Small indeed—and useless on top of that! Your affection certainly comes cheap.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well—I—

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: No need to say more, %random(go play with your “gift”./see if anyone else wants your “affection”.)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh %sweetie%, please take this small offering as a presentation of my undying passion for you.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: My goodness, %i%, this is %random(the most grand thing I’ve ever received!/such a kind of loving gesture /quite the lovely gift)%

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Anything for you, %sweetie%.
%greeting% %sweetie%. I brought you a little something. You understand…as a…romantic gesture.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Uhh…thank you, I guess, but I do not want any token of affection.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Consider it a token of something else then—just remember I gave it to you out of love…

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That is exactly my point dear %gender(i, Sir/ Madam)%, but…oh, well, never mind.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, can I bother you with a quick story? I’m not sure why, but it just came to mind and I feel so powerfully to share it with someone.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Certainly %i%. What’s on your mind?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Just a small tale from when I was a %gender(i, lad, lass)%. I was living in the city at the time and I had a terrible nightmare. I woke up to my mother cooing over me. She made me a small meal, a peanut butter and apple butter sandwich, goodness it was good, and she stayed up with me and just talked until I fell back asleep. I really miss her.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hm, that is a kind story. She sounds like a remarkable woman, you mother. Thank you for sharing with me.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah…it’s silly…but, thank you for listening.
%r%, have I yet told you that you remind me greatly of a good friend I had in my youth? You act a great deal like %gender(r, him, her)%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mm, if you did or didn’t I’m not so entirely sure because I’m sorry to say I don’t much fancy hearing about your childhood.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You look a lot like you have something on your mind %r%. Do you want to talk about it?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: It’s nothing important, really. I just had a thought about my %random(old Aunt, cousin, Uncle, grandmother)%. I never saw much of them growing up, but every birthday they’d send me a letter. I wish I knew them better.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %gender(i, Heh heh, Tee-hee)%. That last part rhymed. It sounds like they love you very much.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: They really did…thank you for listening %i%, you are such a %sweetie%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: It’s truly my pleasure.
This weather reminds me quite strongly of my time spent at camp as a youth. I went to a summer camp just a little north of the big city for a season.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Summer camp? Oh how posh. That sounds positively miserable!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well it wasn’t so bad really. I remember laughing so hard one meal time, a bully was picking on a little boy; and a tough girl a year older than me, she was always just and kind, threw a chair at the bully and said “take a seat”. I blew milk through my nose I really did!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Ugh, what a boring story. It sounds like a horrid experience, and that girl sounds like she should have minded her own business. It’s a shame your childhood sounds so uncanny.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Humph! Well aren’t you just a %pejorative%! I can’t believe you.

You want to know something strange? This manor brings me back to my trip to Ithe south continent when I was a %gender(i, lad, lass)%. I stayed in a grand estate with my great grandparents. They had a pet lion too! Full grown!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: …Your grandparents had a pet lion?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Indeed! It was grand, and fluffy as ever.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: A lion in the south. There are very strict rules about that. Laws actually—not rules—however did your parents manage to work around that?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well, my parents were smarter than the law that came to claim that lion, that is for certain...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You mean your grandparents?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Why, yes, thank you. My grandparents paid off the police actually. I watched it happen.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: They must have been drug lords or some other babble then.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: …What?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: There are no laws against having Lions as pets in the south.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh…well maybe…maybe they were drug lords…or something…I think I’m quite done with this conversation actually—a bit of an ache has nestled it’s way into my bowels.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mm-hmm…

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: So %r%, I think it's time that we took our relationship to the next level...would you want to, ahem, enjoy each other's company in a more physical way?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That sounds positively tantalizing, %sweetie%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: So, %r%, I know you're absolutely in love with me, so why don't we go make good on our emotions?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I...think I'd rather not.

Rule.name: intent-add status: responder is dating other

Predicate.name: intent-add status: responder is dating other

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %i% tells %r% that %o% wants to date %r%. %r% accepts!
%i% tells %r% that %o% wants to date %r% but %r% is indecisive and doesn't know what %gender(r, he, she)% wants to do.
%r% rejects %i% offering for %r% to date %o% because %r% doesn't like %o% all that much.
%i% persuades %r% to date %o% with a good banter!
%i% tells %r% that %r% should be nicer to their family member, %o%, and %r% reluctantly agrees.
%i% tells %r% to be nicer to their family but %r% disagrees about having to.
%i% persuades %r% to be nicer to their family, but %r% seems to be upset with %i%.
%r% is forgiving toward %o% now that %i% has suggested that %r% be kinder.
%r% reacts hostily toward %i% for even suggesting that %r% be nice to %o% after all that %o% has done.
%i% convinces %r% that %o% is a great person to be friends with.
%i% tries to convince %r% of how great %o% is but %r% doesn't care and doesn't want to be friends with %o%.
Using charm and tact, %i% convinces %r% to like %o% more.
%r% is jealous of %o% and %i%'s friendship and gets angry at %i%.
%r% is stubborn and won't agree to being nicer to %o%.
%r% expresses that they had no idea %o% thought that %r% didn't like %o%, and now %r% will try to show it more.
%r%, have you ever heard of the north Witch Trials? It was a huge event in our country's history.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Of course I’ve heard of them! I’m actually a large proprietor of all things witchcraft—I find the lore fascinating. How about the werewolf scare in the 15th century? Lycans are rather fascinating don’t you think?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I—I do, yes! I didn’t really think anyone else could have such a strange fascination. Do you think things like that actually exist?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hm…well I can certainly see the possibility. This has been a fun talk %sweetie%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hm, do you know what I would very much fancy doing right now? %random(Reading—I do enjoy a good bout of poetry now and again, Horseback riding—the horses here at the manor really remind me of my youth—when I’d ride almost all the time, Going for a nice swim! The weather seems a bit chilly but the sensation of being in water is just…fascinatingly freeing)%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Huh. Well that is a funny sort of thing. I was just thinking about that not too long ago myself. It’s a grand hobby really, isn’t it?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Absolutely! Who would have figured we had something like that in common? Maybe we were made for one another!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Mm, it’s not so odd…unfortunately. Taking things a little fast aren’t we %i%?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r% doesn't like whatever hobby %i% brings up as a point of interest and says so quite firmly.
%r% seems to be in an irritable mood and doesn't want to share interests at all.
Afternoon, %r%, I was hoping you'd endeavor to maybe, kiss me on the cheek? I've been dying for a %gender(r, handsome man, pretty girl)% to do so.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hmm...that doesn't sound quite so bad at all, %sweetie%. Come here a moment.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: That was as delightful as I imagined it would be.
Oh %gender(r, most handsome, most beautiful) %r%, let me kiss your forehead!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Ugh, get away from me you %pejorative%!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %i% is very charming while flirting and really impresses %r%.
%r% seems unhappy about it, but decides to be nice and accept %i%'s flirt anyway.
%r% is very shy and doesn't have a high enough romance with %i% to accept the flirt.
%i% is arrogant and their romance with %r% is not high enough to convince %r% to accept the flirt.

Rule.name: intent-remove status: responder is enemies with other

Predicate.name: intent-remove status: responder is enemies with other

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %i% suggests that %r% makes a truce with %o%, and %r% accepts, somewhat hesitantly.
%i% suggests %r% makes a truce with %o%, but %r% doesn't want to make a truce.
%r% is forgiving and decides to accept the truce %i% suggests.
%i% is tactful and carefully suggests a truce between %r% and %o%, which %r% decides to accept.
%i% tells %r% a nasty secret about %o%, which makes %r% distrust %o%.
%i% tries to backstab %o% but %r% doesn't want anything to do with the information.
%r% reacts in a hostile manner toward what %i% tells %gender(r, him, her)% regarding %o%.
%i% tells %r% a false secret about %o%, which %r% believes.
%r% is loyal and kind and does not take %i% at their word regarding what they have said about %o%.
%r% giggles at the secret %i% tells, and %o% catches word of what happened.
%i% tells something inconsequential to %r% which humors %o% and makes them like %i% more.
%r% is gabby and enjoys participating in the gossip. %o% hears about all this and dislikes both %r% and %i%.
%i% tells %r% a secret, but %r% disaproves, and doesn't like %i% as much.

Rule.name: Not sure how to do this, but basically the player must have knowledge about the Other

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %i% tells %r% about what %o% has done. %r% is aghast.
%i% attempts to tell %r% what %o% has done but %r% won't listen.
%i% persuades %r% regarding what %o% has done, despite %r% being loyal.
%i% tells %r% about %o%, but %r% believes that %i% is just being dishonest.
%i% tells %r% about %o% and %r% immediately decides to estrange themself from %o%.
%i% tells %r% about %o% but %r% is so loyal that they refuse to believe what %i% has said.
%i% tells %r% mean things about %o% to try and win %r% to %i%'s side. It works.
%r% doesn't approve of %i% trying to turn %gender(r, him, her)% against their family.
%i% persuades %r% to look at their family member a little differently.
%r% is unforgiving and disapproving and is upset with both %i% and %o% for what has just taken place.
%i% tells %r% nasty secrets about %o%, but %r% guesses that it is because %i% is angry at %o% and so they pay it no mind.
%i% tells %r% that %i% is disapointed with %r% and %r% acknowledges the feelings and is sad.
%i% tries to express %gender(i, his, her)% disapointment but %r% just thinks it's funny.
%i% says something snide to %r% who is very hurt.
%i% tells %r% that %gender(i, he, she)% isn't happy with %r% and expresses so angrily. %r% if forgiving and understands, making %i% feel a little bad.
%r% is embarrassed and takes the criticism hard.
%r% is vulnerable and %i% comment really hurts %r% in a bi way.
Basic Accept for move: I says something that embarrasses R.
Basic Reject for Move: I attempts to embarrass R but fails miserably, making R laugh more than anything.
R is confident and is decent friends with I so he isn't all that upset at being embarrassed.
R is vengeful and becomes very angry with I after they embarrass R.
R is forgiving and forgives I even though I embarrasses R.
I is snide and says something very mean which embrrasses R.
Basic accept for move: i says something to r to make r realize how important their family bond with other is.
Basic reject: initiator attempts to tell responder about importance of family but only makes it worse, decreasing i's relationship with other.
Initiator and responder have a good buddy network and initiator is charming. Initiator says something charming that really turns responder's relationship with other around.
Initiator tries but is unsuccessful in convincing responder to like their family member because they are unforgiving.
Initiator says something stupid and responder doesn't believe any of this is responder's business.
I is dishonest and tells R that O has said something that he is not, but R is observant and calls initiator's bluff and is angry.
Initiator confides in R and R is accepting of what I says, increasing their trust.
R does not accept what I says and tells I off.
I shyly confides in R and R is kind so R encourages I and is pleasant toward I.
I confides something nasty that he/she has done and because R is fogiving R is nice to I about it.
R is sympathtic and understands where I is coming from when I confides in R. R has done something similar as well, which boosts trust.
R is oblivious and doesn't understand that I is trying to get something off their chest.

Rule.name: intent-remove status: responder is dating initiator

Predicate.name: intent-remove status: responder is dating initiator

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, I'd like to pretend this hurts more than it does but I don't think I'd like to pursue my relationship with you any further.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Humph. That sounds fine by me. It was getting boring anyhow.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, I've found that I really just don't like you much. This relationship is over.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: No! I love you!
I really love you! I can't believe you want to do this to me! You are a terrible %gender(i, boyfriend, girlfriend)%!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I....well, huh...okay then...maybe we can give it another chance.
%i% says something nasty to %r%, and the both of them break up, with %r% very upset with %i%
%r% is stubborn and refuses to break up obligingly with %i%, who grows frustrated.
%i% kindly breaks up with %r% so that there are no ill feelings between the two of them.
%r% takes %i%'s really terrible family advice, which impacts %r% and %o%'s relationship.
%% tries to give %r% bad advice, but %r% doesn't take it because they want to keep a good relationship with %o%.
%r% is angry at %o% and takes %i%'s advice that will further negatively impact the realtionship.
%r% is resentful toward %o% and listens intently to %i%'s suggestions...
%r% is kind and loyal, forgiving %o% for their part in the bad relationship. %r% refutes %i%'s council.
%i% tells %r% a secret about %o% and %o% is upset.
%i% tells %r% a secret about %o% but %o% thinks %i% is being silly so doesn't react.
%r% loves %o% and is upset with %i% for trying to betray %o%'s trust.
%r% is grateful to %o% and is upset that %i% is trying to tell a secret about %o%.
%r% is disapproving and doesn't approve of the secret or of %i% telling it.
%i% is confident and tactful and tells the secret in such a way as to anger no one.
%i% persuades %r% to be nicer to %o%.
%i% attempts to persuade %r% to be nicer to %o% but %r% wants nothing to do with the attempt.
%i% tells %r% to be nicer to %o% because %o% is trying, and because %r% is forgiving they agree.
%i% easily persuades %r% to be nicer to %o%, and %r% even thenaks %i% for it.
%i% utilizes their knowledge that %r% is feeling guilty to persuade %r% to be nicer to %o%.
%r% is angry at %o% and so doesn't listen to %i%'s plea for %r% to be nicer to their family member.

InfluenceRule.name: initiator wants to play buddy up games with a kind responder
initiator really wants to play bud up games with a charming responder
initiator really wants to play bud up games with a charismatic responder
Initiator wants to play bud up games with a shy responder
initiator wants to make friends
initiator wants to better friendships and is more likely to play bud up games
in general, initiator does not want to play buddy down games with responder if bud network is high
initiator doesn't want to play bud down games with a potential romance
initiator doesn't want to play buddy down games with a kind responder
in general, initiator wants to play romance up games
initiator really wants to play romance up games with a potential romance interest
initiator heavily wants to play romance up games with a confident responder
initiator heavily wants to play romance up games with a charismatic romance interest
initiator wants to play a game with an embarrassed responder
initiator doesn't want to be buddies with responder
i doesn't want romance with r
i doesn't need high trust with r
i doesn't want to have high family bond with r
i wants to be buddies with an independent responder
i wants to be romantic with independent r
i wants to trust an independent r
i wants to have a good family bond with independent r
i no buddy with domineering r
i no romancy with domineering r

I wants others to love them...who doesn't?
